description:
The project aims to create a wedding inspiration mobile app that serves as a map-based, Pinterest-style platform. The app will allow users to discover, save, and share wedding photo locations and inspirations. With a focus on community-based content, the app enables brides and grooms to explore real wedding photos, interact with photographers and venues, and easily share their findings with their wedding team. The platform will provide personalized content through a questionnaire at the start and will feature a public feed for discovering content. Users can follow other users and create curated feeds based on their interests, allowing for a more tailored experience. Social features like commenting, liking, bookmarking, and sharing will further engage users and keep the platform dynamic.
Platform:
Mobile app (iOS and Android)
User Types and Descriptions:
Brides & Grooms (End Users)
Description: Brides and grooms who are in the process of planning their weddings will use the app to find inspiration for wedding photos, discover wedding venues, and gather location-based photo ideas. They will save and organize their favorite finds, collaborate with their wedding team, and interact with other users to get inspiration and recommendations.
Purpose: To explore wedding photography inspiration, save and share locations, and create a personalized feed based on preferences, making wedding planning easier.
Photographers & Videographers (Service Providers)
Description: Photographers and videographers will create profiles to showcase their work, tag their photos with locations, and gain exposure by sharing their portfolio with brides and grooms. They will be able to interact with potential clients through the platform by receiving inquiries or collaboration requests.
Purpose: To gain exposure, advertise services, and build a professional presence by sharing wedding photos and offering their services.
Venues (Business Profiles)
Description: Venues will create business profiles where they can list their wedding services, showcase wedding photo spots, and provide recommendations for ideal locations within the venue. They will promote their venue by uploading images of weddings held there.
Purpose: To attract brides and grooms by showcasing wedding venues, offering photo spot suggestions, and gaining visibility within the app.
Admin (App Administrator)
Description: The app administrator is responsible for managing user profiles, overseeing content moderation, ensuring the app runs smoothly, and monitoring analytics. They will also manage monetization, handle support requests, and enforce community guidelines.
Purpose: To ensure proper functioning, manage content, and oversee user support and monetization strategies.
Technical Functional Features of Each User:
1. Bride/Groom (Wedding Planner)
These are the main features for the bride and groom user types:
Account Creation & Questionnaire
Users create an account via email sign-up.
Upon sign-up, a personalized questionnaire is presented to gather preferences such as:
State of mind (e.g., excited, stressed)
Wedding venue preferences
Photography style preferences (e.g., candid, formal)
Location
The questionnaire responses will be used to curate personalized content, including photos, venues, and vendors.
Personalized Content Feed
The app will generate a curated content feed based on user preferences and saved inspirations from the questionnaire.
This feed will display relevant venues, photo locations, and photographer portfolios.
Community Interaction
Users can interact with other brides/grooms for inspiration, advice, or suggestions under public posts.
Ability to post questions and share tips within a community of wedding planners.
Search & Filter Functionality
Users can search and filter through wedding venues, photo spots, and locations based on the following:
Location (city, state, or venue name)
Wedding theme (e.g., rustic, modern)
Venue type (e.g., outdoor, indoor)
The search results will display photo spots for specific venues or areas surrounding a selected venue.
Save Inspirations
Users can save photos of wedding venues, locations, and inspiration pictures to their personal boards (bookmarks).
Saved items can be categorized and edited (e.g., “Bridal Photos” or “Reception Locations”).
Users will be able to view and revisit their saved content at any time.
Share Inspirations
Users can share saved photos and inspiration boards directly with their photographer, family, or friends via:
Email links
In-app sharing feature
Social media sharing (Instagram, Pinterest, Facebook)
Ability to send inspiration directly to photographers using a direct messaging feature inside the app.
Create & Export Wedding Day Timeline
Users can create a timeline (run sheet) of their wedding day by dragging and dropping saved photos or venues into specific time slots (e.g., Ceremony, Reception).
This timeline can be exported to PDF format or shared as a link with vendors or wedding planners.
Subscription Model
Access to premium content (exclusive photo spots, venue listings) through a subscription model.
Users can opt for a monthly or annual subscription for access to additional tools and inspiration content.
Payment gateway integration (e.g., Stripe or PayPal) to manage subscriptions and payments.
2. Photographer/Videographer
For the photographers and videographers, these are the technical features:
Profile Creation
Photographers can create a detailed profile showcasing their portfolio.
Profiles will include:
Bio and background information
Gallery of photos (e.g., wedding photos, location-specific shoots)
Contact details and booking information
Rate card (if applicable)
Portfolio Uploads
Photographers can upload photos and videos of their work.
The ability to tag photos with location data (specific wedding venues or photo spots) to increase discoverability.
Photo permissions: Photographers can only upload images with user permission (e.g., from the bride/groom).
Photo Engagement Analytics
Engagement statistics: Track likes, comments, and shares on uploaded photos.
Lead Generation
Photographers will be featured as part of a verified professional list for specific wedding venues or locations.
Request/Contact button on each photographer’s profile for direct booking inquiries.
Profile Updates
Photographers can regularly update their portfolios with new work.
They will have the ability to respond to reviews from clients and build their reputation within the community.
3. Venue (Business Profile)
For venues, the following technical features are needed:
Venue Profile Creation
Venues can create a business profile with the following information:
Venue name, description, and services
Gallery of available photo spots (e.g., gardens, reception halls)
Contact details (address, phone number, website)
Pricing details (optional)
Photo and Location Tagging
Venues can tag specific locations within the venue (e.g., “Garden Spot 1” or “Reception Area 3”) so that users (brides/grooms) can search for photos by venue or photo spot.
Promotions & Special Offers
Venues can post promotions (e.g., discounts, special packages) or events directly on their profile page.
Venues can advertise on the app to gain visibility and attract users.
Analytics Dashboard
Venues can access analytics to see how often their venue is being viewed and interacted with.
4. Admin (Platform Management)
For platform admins, the key features are:
Centralized Dashboard
Admins have access to a comprehensive dashboard that allows them to manage all aspects of the platform.
View user activity, photo uploads, venue listings, and overall engagement across the app.
User & Content Moderation
Admins can approve or reject user profiles, photographer profiles, venue listings, and uploaded photos.
Content flagged by users can be reviewed, and inappropriate content can be removed.
Subscription & Payment Management
Admins manage the subscription model, ensuring users are billed correctly for premium features.
Invoice generation for venue advertisements and photographer subscriptions.
Ability to provide discounts or special offers for users or businesses.
Reporting & Analytics
Admins can generate reports on user activity, engagement statistics, and revenue generation.
Real-time analytics to track growth, subscriptions, and content interactions.
Email & Notification Management
Admins can send system-wide notifications for app updates, promotions, and maintenance alerts.
Email automation for welcome messages, subscription reminders, and event notifications.
Integrations Needed
Payment Gateway:
For subscriptions and advertising fees (e.g., Stripe, PayPal).
Map Integration:
Apple Maps (iOS) for location-based searches and tagging of photo spots.
Social Media Integration:
Instagram, Pinterest, Facebook for sharing inspiration photos.

Handle receiving and sending push notifications
